column4: my pen drive always mounts as read-only file system! this is my dmesg output! http://tinypaste.com/ea91c
even if i put umask=000 while mounting!
all the FAT errors indicate that the filesystem is going readonly to prevent any damage from being done to an apparently corrupt filesystem
you might think about, with the stuick unmounted, doing: sudo fsck /dev/sdd1
use first FAT? what about the options? truncate first or second?
I've never had to fsck a FAT filesystem (from Linux) before, so I'm not entirely certain
no good! :( the filesystem still shouts read only!
hmm. This the only thumb drive you're having trouble with?
this is the second one! i even formatted the first one i tried!
did you try perhaps a different USB port or hub?
can the problem be in my system's config? i dont think anything went wrong in these pendrives!
yeah, tried all of them!
anything??
The only thing that keeps coming to mind is to make sure the stick(s) isn't/aren't the problem by trying them on another system, but it's unlikely you'll have two sticks go bad at the same time
yeah! that's what! well, it can me my fault though! the copy speed was damn slow(200kps) so i cancelled it n tried to unmount! didn't work! so i just pulled it off! - same case with both of them!
hmm, that could indeed corrupt the FAT tables quite nicely
lol! yeah! but then i formatted them!
now just check what happened, i mounted the first screwed up thumbdrive, the file icon in computer:/// shows unknown type! n when i tried copying thru cli with root, it worked!
in a word, interesting.
so what can you say? what should i do with my second thumbdrive? try formatting it?
well, if there's nothing you want to keep on the drive, formatting it can't really do any harm
well, after some formatting job, its working! but the transfer speed is pathetic!
